explosives.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_gases.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (2000): the lower explosion limit is 8.1vol%. Classified into Division 2.1 (UN#1063) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified into Division 2.1 (UN#1063) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

gases_under_pressure.hazard_statement: Contains gas under pressure; may explode if heated
gases_under_pressure.rationale: The boiling point is -24.2degC (ICSC 2000), and the critical temperature is 143.10degC (HSDB 2005) - i.e., liquefied gases. Classified into Division 2.1 (UN#1063) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

organic_peroxides.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Insufficient data available, though classified into Category 4 according to the rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,800mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) (The details of the administration are unknown.)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of gas) of 2,566ppm (SIDS (2004)), representing the lower of the two testing data, 2,566mg/kg (SIDS (2004)) and 2,700mg/kg (SIDS (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its vapour is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its dust/mist is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: No data available. Exposure to the liquefied gas may cause frostbite (ICSC (J) (2000)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: No data available. Exposure to the liquefied gas may cause frostbite (ICSC (J) (2000)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on positive data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), described in SIDS (2004).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (1999), Category A4 by ACGIH (2001) and Group D by EPA (2001).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in the report on mouse teratogenicity tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.40 (2004)): malformations are observed in offspring at dose levels not toxic to parent animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, cardiovascular system), Category 2 (liver, kidney), Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, cardiovascular system) May cause damage to organs (liver, kidney) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "dizziness caused by inhalation exposure, debility, blurred vision, ataxia, lethargy, insomnia, confusion, paresthesia, neurosis, ademonia, nausea," "severe headache caused by oral ingestion, intoxication, somnolency, ataxia, speech disorder" and "electrocardiographic abnormality, tachycardia, an increase in hear rate, a decrease in blood pressure" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.40 (2004)) and the evidence from animal studies including "toxicity to the liver and kidneys, cerebellar degeneration" (CICAD 28 (2000). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, central nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "jaundice, anuria, albuminuria" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.40 (2004)), "adverse effects on the central nervous system such as difficulties in accommodation and diplopia" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)) and "adverse effects on the liver and kidneys" (ACGIH 7th (2001)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 48 hours EC50=200mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (SIDS (2004) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =5320mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
